timeline.bodyText: I guess this is separate to the core JBTM in this PR?
timeline.author: tomjenkinson

replies.bodyText: Well the bean is ApplicationScoped so using a static makes little difference.
replies.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText: Agreed, it looks right not to be static but is it related to https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3243 is what I was getting at.
replies.author: tomjenkinson

replies.bodyText: Well I think so since the PR is all about getting the semantics of an ApplicationScoped bean correct and using statics in such a bean is counter intuitive.
replies.author: mmusgrov

timeline.bodyText: I note that this is currently a no-op but I wonder if a separate JBTM should be removing from the RecordTypeManager to reverse the install?

replies.bodyText: I provided an implementation for Implementations.uninstall()

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure what the %n refers to here. I think it would be fine to correct the typo given it is debug statement and is being edited in this PR
timeline.author: tomjenkinson

replies.bodyText: It wasn't introduced by the PR but I agree it's a good opportunity to correct it.
replies.author: mmusgrov

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this dependency should be required now? Or at least javax/annotation is not provided directly inside it. If a dependency is required I suspect it would be on one from https://search.maven.org/artifact/jakarta.annotation/jakarta.annotation-api
timeline.author: tomjenkinson

timeline.bodyText: was this part a general tidy up or was it related to JBTM-3243? if general I think it needs a separate issue?
timeline.author: tomjenkinson

replies.bodyText: Really! Perhaps if I remember I will include it in a general tidy up sometime.
replies.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText: It's not caused by https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3243 is it? But as our LRA implementation is not complete perhaps just a separate commit would suffice?
replies.author: tomjenkinson

replies.bodyText: The problem with having to raise a JBTM against every trivial issue on a code base that is tracking an evolving pre-release spec is that is slows down progress to delivering a first cut of the s/w
replies.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText: yeah, I tend to agree for the tidy up stuff. a separate commit though would be reasonable as it's not accurate to include it in a commit for a JBTM which does not apply, WDYT?
replies.author: tomjenkinson

replies.bodyText: Sure, a separate commit in the same PR would work for me (not in this one though since I reverted the change).
